pkgmetadata.longdescription: Tcsh is an enhanced, but completely compatible version of the Berkeley UNIX C shell (csh). It is a command language interpreter usable both as an interactive login shell and a shell script command processor. It includes a command-line editor, programmable word completion, spelling correction, a history mechanism, job control and a C-like syntax.

portnotes.note: installation was done with double prefix, solved with einstall and overriding bindir and libdir. tcsh needs, like other shells some special treatment with regard to the prefixed install it is in, since it has to fetch its configuration files (/etc/csh.*) from the prefix as well. The contents of these files also needs to reflect the prefix. This is now being catered for in the ebuild.
